name: Posterior Tibial Tendon Dysfunction (Stage II)
chief_complaint: My inner ankle hurts and my foot is flattening out when I walk.
symptoms: Pain along the inside of the ankle and foot
physical_findings: Tenderness to palpation posterior to medial malleolus
Visible collapse of medial longitudinal arch with single-leg heel rise

lab_results.MRI: Partial tearing and degeneration of posterior tibial tendon
lab_results.X-ray: Measures show >30% uncovering of talar head

treatment: Custom orthotics with medial arch support
Consider surgical reconstruction if conservative measures fail
prognosis: Good with early intervention; may progress to rigid flatfoot deformity if untreated
description: Progressive condition where the posterior tibial tendon fails to support the arch, leading to acquired adult flatfoot deformity. Stage II involves flexible deformity with tendon degeneration but no fixed contractures.
